properties.Name: OrderOfSuccession
properties.Description:
A means of classifying beneficiary designations.

Order of Succession addresses the case where a beneficiary to a life insurance policy dies prior to the  insured.

Designations may or may not be changed.

Ex:
- Class Beneficiary
- Primary Beneficiary
- Secondary Beneficiary
- Tertiary Beneficiary

CLASS BENEFICIARY
A group of insured having the  same general characteristics and who are grouped together for rating purposes.

Class Beneficiary  is a means of specifying a class or group of beneficiaries ("My Family", "My Children" �)

PRIMARY BENEFICIARY
Primary Beneficiary is the  party designated to receive the  proceeds of an insurance policy when it becomes payable.

There may be more than one primary beneficiary.

SECONDARY BENEFICIARY
Secondary (AKA 'contingent' or 'successor') Beneficiary may also be named and is second in line to receive the  proceeds of an insurance policy if the  primary beneficiary dies before the  insured.  Secondary beneficiaries are entitled to policy proceeds only if no primary beneficiaries are living.

TERTIARY BENEFICIARY
Tertiary Beneficiary stands third in line to receive the  proceeds of a life insurance policy in cases where all primary and secondary beneficiaries predecease the  insured.

Columns.Name: OrderOfSuccessionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a specific Succession Order.

Columns.Name: OrderOfSuccessionName
Columns.Description: The name of a specific Succession Order.

Columns.Name: OrderOfSuccessionDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a specific Succession Order.
